prng

Class SecureRandomBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • prng.SecureRandomBuilder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SecureRandomBuilder.CipherBuilder, SecureRandomBuilder.HashBuilder, SecureRandomBuilder.HmacBuilder

    public abstract class SecureRandomBuilder
extends Object
    A builder of secure random instances.
    Author:
    Simon

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  SecureRandomBuilder.CipherBuilder
      Create Cipher based RNGs.
      static class  SecureRandomBuilder.Hash
      Hash algorithms used by the RNGs.

      Create Hash based RNGs.
      (package private) static class  SecureRandomBuilder.HmacBuilder
      Create HMAC based RNGs.
      static class  SecureRandomBuilder.Source
      Possible entropy sources

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

      SecureRandom build()
      Build the secure random instance.

      Build the secure random SPI instance.
      static SecureRandomBuilder cipher()
      Create a secure random based upon an AES cipher.
      SecureRandomBuilder entropy(byte[] data)
      Specify the bytes for initial entropy provided to the RNG.
      (package private) abstract String getClassName()
      Get the class name that implements the RNG.
      static SecureRandomBuilder hash()
      Create a secure random based upon a secure hash algorithm (SHA).
      SecureRandomBuilder hash(SecureRandomBuilder.Hash newHash)
      Specify the hash algorithm used by a hash or HMAC based RNG.
      static SecureRandomBuilder hmac()
      Create a secure random based upon a hash based message authentication code (HMAC)
      SecureRandomBuilder laziness(int lazy)
      How lazy is the generator when it comes to requesting new entropy? NIST refer to this parameter as "resistance" but lower values are more secure than higher ones.

      Specify the bytes for a nonce used to initialise the RNG.
      SecureRandomBuilder personalization(byte[] data)
      Specify the bytes for personalization used to initialise the RNG.
      SecureRandomBuilder source(SecureRandomBuilder.Source newSource)
      Specify the seed data source.

        public static SecureRandomBuilder cipher()
        Create a secure random based upon an AES cipher.
        Returns:
        a builder

      • hash

        public static SecureRandomBuilder hash()
        Create a secure random based upon a secure hash algorithm (SHA).
        Returns:
        a builder

      • hmac

        public static SecureRandomBuilder hmac()
        Create a secure random based upon a hash based message authentication code (HMAC)
        Returns:
        a builder

        abstract BaseRandom buildSpi()
        Build the secure random SPI instance.

        public SecureRandom build()
        Build the secure random instance.
        Returns:
        the instance

      • getClassName

        abstract String getClassName()
        Get the class name that implements the RNG.
        Returns:
        the class name

      • entropy

        public SecureRandomBuilder entropy(byte[] data)
        Specify the bytes for initial entropy provided to the RNG. If null, then the system will provide initial entropy from the Fortuna implementation. The default is null.
        Parameters:
        data - the entropy to use (or null)
        Returns:
        this

      • hash

        public SecureRandomBuilder hash(SecureRandomBuilder.Hash newHash)
        Specify the hash algorithm used by a hash or HMAC based RNG. Not applicable to other RNGs.
        Parameters:
        newHash - the hash to use
        Returns:
        this

      • laziness

        public SecureRandomBuilder laziness(int lazy)
        How lazy is the generator when it comes to requesting new entropy? NIST refer to this parameter as "resistance" but lower values are more secure than higher ones.
        Parameters:
        lazy - the amount of laziness (a non-negative integer). The default value is 0.
        Returns:
        this

      • nonce

        public SecureRandomBuilder nonce(byte[] data)
        Specify the bytes for a nonce used to initialise the RNG. If null, then the system will provide a nonce. The default is null.
        Parameters:
        data - the nonce to use (or null)
        Returns:
        this

      • personalization

        public SecureRandomBuilder personalization(byte[] data)
        Specify the bytes for personalization used to initialise the RNG. If null, then the system will provide some data uniquely tied to this JVM. The default is null.
        Parameters:
        data - the personalization to use (or null)
        Returns:
        this

      • source

        public SecureRandomBuilder source(SecureRandomBuilder.Source newSource)
        Specify the seed data source. The default is FORTUNA.
        Parameters:
        newSource - the source
        Returns:
        this
